intro: Thladiantha legendrei, commonly known as the golden gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and edible, tart berries that are often used in local cuisine. It thrives in cool, humid environments and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
